This manual includes relevant Process Safety Information documentation and references; procedures and information for Process Hazard Analysis; references to the facility Operating Procedures and discussion of how they are maintained; a description of training activities and references to training management documentation; applicable safe work practices; procedures for maintenance activities including inspection, testing and preventive maintenance instructions; procedures for Management of Change/Pre-Startup Safety Review; a procedure for conducting 3-year Compliance Audits, management of contractors; and references to corporate Incident Investigation procedures. The manual also includes detailed Hazard Assessment and Risk Management Plan submittal information.

The five-year accident history:
At the time of this RMP submission, there are no RMP-related accidents to report. 

The emergency response program:
The warehouse maintains an emergency action plan which is in place to protect workers and public safety as well as the environment. The warehouse is a defensive facility and relies on local responders when there is a need. The program consists of procedures for evacuating the warehouse and making notifications to appropriate emergency personnel. The Distribution Center Manager coordinates at least annually with the Mount Joy Fire Department to ensure they will be prepared to respond to an emergency at the warehouse. Site employees are regularly trained on the emergency action plan including identification of potential emergency situations, response notification and evacuation.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
Holcim is dedicated to protecting employees, the community, and the environment from highly hazardous incidents through safely operating our facility. Our overall approach and commitment to chemical safety is demonstrated through the existing management, training, procedural, and maintenance systems in place at the facility and the hazard assessment, prevention program and emergency response provisions implemented for the covered process. The site has an integrated management system to ensure safety is documented in the facility's RMP program as well as compliance with applicable regulations, codes, and standards such as OSHAs Process Safety Management (PSM) Program under 29 CFR 1910.119.

Our facility and the regulated substances handled:
Holcim is a distribution warehouse located in Mount Joy, PA. The warehouse handles, stores and distributes various materials for the manufacture of building products, particularly insulation. There is no chemical processing or manufacturing at the warehouse. The covered process entails the receipt, handling, and storage of various products in small containers. 

Some of the products are regulated flammable mixtures which include pentane, ethylene and propylene. The quantity of the covered products stored in the warehouse can fluctuate based on the season, therefore a conservative approach was taken in determining the maximum intended inventory for the covered products. Due to the flammability of the products mentioned above, the Mount Joy facility is covered by OSHA's PSM Program and therefore required to comply with EPA's RMP Program 3 requirements.
